results.content:
Provides good information that lays foundation  for understanding APIs, but the course does not provide a structured approach regarding the API design process. 
As a reult, the API implementation demonstrated in the course seems haphazard and not thought through. A design is supposed to be a well-thought-out process, not just writing a bunch of http requests. I'd say the course is more about how to structure http messages in rest APIs rather than the actual process of designing APIs. It gives useful information for the former, but doesn't touch on the latter. Better to call it "introduction to rest APIs".
results.content_html:

results.content: Not much details. waste of time and money.  He is statically builds the responses on a dumb free website.  You will not learn what he says in a real world client sever environment.  Topics are also very primitive and lacks substance

response.content:
Hi Ehsan,
I'm sorry you feel that way.
The course is using Beeceptor as a simulator for a REST API server, in order to allow real world REST API building and testing without using expensive or platform specific tools (as is clearly stated in the course's landing page).
The only tools used in this course (Beeceptor, Postman, Swagger) are free tools, and, besides Beeceptor, you'll use all of them in a real world REST API development.

I'm not sure what you mean by "very primitive and lacks substance", but the course discusses all aspects of REST API, starting from the very foundation of the REST philosophy, and going through the anatomy of REST interface (verbs, URL, response), performance techniques, and some advanced topics most developers will not use but is always good to know.

Feel free to DM me your specific concerns, and I promise to do my best to improve any concrete problem found.

Cheers,
Memi
response.content_html:
Hi Ehsan,
I'm sorry you feel that way.
The course is using Beeceptor as a simulator for a REST API server, in order to allow real world REST API building and testing without using expensive or platform specific tools (as is clearly stated in the course's landing page).
The only tools used in this course (Beeceptor, Postman, Swagger) are free tools, and, besides Beeceptor, you'll use all of them in a real world REST API development.

I'm not sure what you mean by "very primitive and lacks substance", but the course discusses all aspects of REST API, starting from the very foundation of the REST philosophy, and going through the anatomy of REST interface (verbs, URL, response), performance techniques, and some advanced topics most developers will not use but is always good to know.

Feel free to DM me your specific concerns, and I promise to do my best to improve any concrete problem found.

Cheers,
Memi

Quite weak course from senior architect

results.content:
This is an excellent and a very practical course to know how to design REST API without any prior knowledge. Every section of this course is practical and with details. The added bonus is the Resources material and checklist that you can download and keep it with to help you for designing your own REST API.
Overall, it is a very good course for someone who wants to know how to design REST API.

results.content: Too slow in the first section, picked up pace from section 2 onwards. It would have been great if the course could start building a project from scratch and design APIs for it but enhancing it in each section untill we finally reach the end. E.g. a restaurant, book store or something like that.

results.content: I liked this course. It explains all the main concepts to design a good REST API. I also gets you into the terminology of API design and some tools you can use. It`s clear and concise so you get prepared for more complex and extensive courses. That's how I feel now.
results.content_html: I liked this course. It explains all the main concepts to design a good REST API. I also gets you into the terminology of API design and some tools you can use. It`s clear and concise so you get prepared for more complex and extensive courses. That's how I feel now.

results.content: Well laid out and applicable. Have started a few other courses and never finished but this hits the practical application of API's and brings in the knowledge.
results.content_html: Well laid out and applicable. Have started a few other courses and never finished but this hits the practical application of API's and brings in the knowledge.

results.content:
I have previous experience with REST API's (say with dots of knowledge), This course connected all the dots.

This course is Designed for Beginner level. It could be better if trainer adds few more concepts like (Rest Architecture Features, In detailed discussion about Swagger and RAML and their comparison, In Details API  Security and API Gateway concepts) and makes it for Advanced & Master levels.

Overall it is a good course for Beginners.
results.content_html:
I have previous experience with REST API's (say with dots of knowledge), This course connected all the dots.

This course is Designed for Beginner level. It could be better if trainer adds few more concepts like (Rest Architecture Features, In detailed discussion about Swagger and RAML and their comparison, In Details API Security and API Gateway concepts) and makes it for Advanced & Master levels.

Overall it is a good course for Beginners.

results.content: Comprehensive course that covers all the basics, excellent for beginners. For experienced developers it is good to have everything in one place, but there is likely not a lot of new information or enough deep dives.
results.content_html: Comprehensive course that covers all the basics, excellent for beginners. For experienced developers it is good to have everything in one place, but there is likely not a lot of new information or enough deep dives.

results.content: Good way to get know about the REST API, totally for beginners and a good refresher for experienced.
results.content_html: Good way to get know about the REST API, totally for beginners and a good refresher for experienced.

results.content: The course covers a lot of topics in a very easy to understand format.  The instructor is obviously very knowledgable about the subject.
